full_content.content: Common reasons your LG washer is not washing
The most common reasons your LG washer is not washing are a malfunctioning electronic control board, faulty actuator or a seized gearcase.
We can help! Our service technicians have repaired over
LG washers. We can fix yours no matter where you bought it.
Most common repairs needed to fix a LG washer

A malfunctioning electronic control board can lead to various failures in a washer. This is because the board serves as the brain of the washer, controlling crucial components such as the water valve, drive motor, drain pump, and cycles. If the electronic control board fails, the washer may not power up or display the cycle status. Additionally, it might fail to fill, agitate, spin, or drain. In some cases, a shorted board may emit a burning smell.
How to replace the electronic control board in a washer

A faulty washer actuator, also known as the shifter assembly, will cause difficulty or inability of the washer drive system to shift between different cycles or modes. This may result in the washing machine getting stuck in one phase of the laundry process, preventing it from progressing through the entire cycle. There may be unusual noises during operation, such as grinding or clicking sounds, which may indicate a malfunctioning actuator. A faulty actuator may also prevent the washer from agitating or spinning properly, affecting the overall washing performance. In some cases, a malfunctioning actuator can lead to the washing machine not completing the cycle or stopping abruptly.
How to replace the actuator on a top-load washer

A seized washer gearcase exhibits noticeable symptoms during operation. You may hear loud grinding or rumbling noises, particularly during the agitating or spinning cycles. The washer drum might not turn as smoothly, resulting in jerky or uneven movements, or it may completely stop agitating or spinning. Additionally, the washer might experience difficulty in shifting between different cycles. Over time, the increased friction and strain on the seized gearcase may cause overheating, emitting a burning smell. A seized gearcase should be replaced by a Sears Home Services professional.
How to replace the gearcase in a washer
Why is my LG washing machine not washing?
Poor washing results from your LG washing machine can be caused by many different issues. Here are some things to check.
Check for an Unbalanced Load or Overloading
Overloading the washer or having an unbalanced load will result in poor washing results.
Follow the guidelines in your owner’s manual for proper loading.
If the washer is overloaded, pull some garments out and restart the cycle.
If the load is unbalanced, untangle and redistribute the load in the basket and then restart the cycle.
An unlevel washer or instability in the leveling legs can result in poor washing results. Follow the guidelines in the owner’s manual to properly level and stabilize the washing machine.

To check for washer stability, press down on the diagonally opposing corners of the top washer panel. If you detect any play or rocking, adjust the leveling feet to eliminate the play and stabilize the washer.

full_content.content: LG front-load washers have a drain pump filter that needs cleaning at least every 6 months – sometimes more often.
Check that filter as shown in the image above and clear out lint and debris that you find in the filter.

full_content.content: Maintain your washing machine according to the guidelines in your owner’s manual.
Follow the tips from Sears Home Services Technician Tom Charland in this video to help keep your washer working at its best:
by a Sears Home Services technician to keep your machine in top shape and washing properly.
What to expect when you experience an LG washer not washing issue
How is the not washing problem fixed?

Correcting most not washing problems usually involves replacing the electronic control board, actuator or gearcase. However, there are many potential causes, so a thorough diagnosis is key to fixing the problem. An accurate diagnosis is essential to understanding how much the repair will be.
Sears Home Services recommendations for a washer that is not washing
When the washer is not washing it can be for many reasons. To avoid replacing unneeded parts, we recommend scheduling
with a local Sears Home Services professional who can perform diagnostic tests to identify the root cause of the problem. Our technicians are experienced at diagnosing all types of washer failures.
What to look out for with a washer not washing diagnosis

Diagnosing modern appliances without proper knowledge and training can be difficult. Without using proper diagnostic techniques, fixing your washer problem will only be achieved through changing parts on a hunch. Appliances, especially in the last 10 years, have become extremely advanced, and many models have electronic parts that are difficult to test. DIY repairs on the latest appliance models are becoming increasingly difficult.
If your LG washer fills but never agitates or tumbles, a broken motor or drive belt often stalls the wash action. Clothes remain dirty despite water flow. Instead of half-clean loads, get a
. Once agitation returns, you’ll enjoy fresh results each cycle.
What our customers say about us
With more than 1.3 Million 5 Star Reviews, you don't have to take our word for it

full_content.content: Why isn’t my LG washer washing clothes?
Common issues include a broken drive belt, malfunctioning lid switch, or clogged filter. Check these components for defects.
How can I fix my LG washer that isn’t washing clothes?
Inspect the drive belt, lid switch, and filter. Replace any malfunctioning parts to restore washing function.
Could a clogged filter prevent my LG washer from washing clothes?
Yes, a clogged filter can disrupt the washing process. Clean or replace the filter to resolve the issue.
What should I do if my LG washer isn’t washing clothes?
Check the drive belt, lid switch, and filter. Replace any damaged parts to restore washing function.

full_content.content: Is your top-loading washer acting up? Discover troubleshooting tips for common issues like water leaks, excessive vibrations, failure to fill with water, detergent residue, and startup problems.

full_content.content: How Does a Mixing Valve Work?
Learn how a mixing valve works to control water temperature in a washer.
What is the drum of the washing machine?
The drum is the core part of the washer that holds your laundry and enables the cleaning process through rotation, agitation, and rinsing.
Hard water is water that contains high levels of dissolved minerals, particularly calcium and magnesium. It contrasts with soft water, which has lower concentrations of these minerals.
What is a Washing Machine Pedestal?
A washing machine pedestal is a platform that raises the washer off the ground, providing easier access to the appliances and often includes additional storage space such as drawers.

A washer tub is the interior part of a washing machine where clothes are placed for washing, typically made of stainless steel, plastic, or porcelain-coated metal, designed to hold water and withstand the agitation or spinning during the wash cycle.
Additional possible LG washer symptoms you may experience
LG washer start button not responding
LG washer top load model not filling with water
LG washer water not covering clothes
These washer brands may also experience not washing

full_content.content: Your Opt Out Preference Signal is Honored
Notice of Right to Opt Out of Sale/Sharing

This website uses cookies and other tracking technologies (“Cookies”) to serve targeted ads, enhance user experience, and to analyze user activity. Some Cookies may collect personal information that is used in a way that is considered a “Sale”, “Sharing”, or “Targeted Advertising” as those terms are defined under various state privacy laws. To opt out of Cookie based Sales, Sharing, and Targeted Advertising, please follow the instructions below. To opt out of non-Cookie based Sales, Sharing, and Targeted Advertising, please visit our webform
. Please visit our Privacy Policy linked below, including the State Specific Disclosures section for more information about your rights and our privacy practices.

full_content.attributes: {'href': 'https://www.searshomeservices.com/privacy#california-residents', 'class': ['privacy-notice-link'], 'rel': ['noopener'], 'target': '_blank', 'aria-label': 'More information about your privacy, opens in a new tab'}

full_content.content: You can move the toggle above to the left to opt out of Cookie-based Sales, Sharing, and Targeted Advertising. Please note that your opt-out choice is specific to this website, browser, and device. If you access other Transformco websites, you will need to make your election for each. Also, if you clear your Cookies on this browser or use another browser or device, you may need to opt out again on this website.

Please note: Opting out may affect our ability to personalize your experience on this website, though we may use Cookies that do not include Sales, Sharing, or Targeted Advertising. You may still receive non-personalized advertisements on other sites or personalized ads that may be based on information processed before you opted out.

This website recognizes the Global Privacy Control (“GPC”), which is designed to recognize certain browser-based opt-out preference signals. We will process the GPC signal as a request to opt out. To process your request through GPC, you must use a browser or browser extension that supports the signal and turn it on for each browser and device you use.
